name: FoodDash
description: Hyperlocal food delivery app connecting users with nearby home cooks and small restaurants. Focus on homemade meals at affordable prices with 30-min delivery guarantee.

problem.statement: Food delivery apps like Swiggy/Zomato mainly feature restaurants with high markups (30-40% platform fee + delivery). Home cooks and small tiffin services have no digital presence, so students and young professionals miss out on affordable, homemade meals near them.
problem.impact: Students in India spend ₹150-300 per meal on delivery apps while a home-cooked meal nearby could cost ₹60-100. There are 50M+ students and 100M+ working professionals who eat out daily. Home cooks (mostly women) lose potential income without a platform.
problem.currentSolution: People find home cooks through WhatsApp groups, word-of-mouth, or local flyers. Some use Swiggy/Zomato despite high prices. Instagram-based home bakeries exist but have no ordering/delivery system. No unified app exists for this niche.

competitors.name: Swiggy
strengths: Massive restaurant network and delivery fleet
Multi-billion dollar backing and brand trust
gaps: No support for home cooks or small kitchens
Minimum order values exclude budget users

competitors.name: Zomato
strengths: Strong brand recognition and user reviews
Zomato Gold provides value for frequent users
gaps: High delivery fees for small orders
No home cook / tiffin service category
Focus on urban metros, weak in tier-2 cities

competitors.name: Local Tiffin Services (WhatsApp-based)
strengths: Personal touch and consistent home-style taste
Flexible — can customize meals on request
No platform commission, so prices stay low
gaps: Unreliable — no tracking or delivery guarantee

decisions.title: Mobile framework?
decisions.reasoning: Already know React. Expo simplifies builds, OTA updates, and has great ecosystem. Flutter would mean learning Dart. Native doubles the codebase. KMP is too new.

decisions.title: Backend framework?
decisions.reasoning: 2-3x faster than Express, built-in schema validation, great TypeScript support. NestJS is over-engineered for an MVP. Django would mean switching to Python.

decisions.title: How to handle location-based queries?
decisions.reasoning: PostGIS is the gold standard for spatial queries. ST_DWithin for radius search is incredibly fast with GiST indexes. We already use PostgreSQL so no extra database. MongoDB geo is okay but we prefer SQL.

decisions.title: Payment gateway?
decisions.reasoning: Best UPI integration in India. Great developer docs. Split payments feature for cook payouts. Stripe doesn't support UPI well. Razorpay has instant settlement option.

decisions.title: Real-time delivery tracking approach?
decisions.reasoning: Bidirectional communication needed for both tracking updates and order status changes. Firebase Realtime DB adds vendor lock-in. SSE is one-way only. Polling wastes bandwidth.
